title: Paneer Pancake Recipe

ingredient.description: Whole Eggs , or Flax Meal Egg Replacer

method:
1.
Beat eggs in a clean and dry bowl till light and fluffy.

2.
Add sugar and beat till the sugar is combined. Stir in the smooth paneer, baking powder, plain flour and salt to the beaten egg mixture. Add the milk and whisk to combine well. You should have a thick pancake batter.

3.
Heat a skillet over low heat. Melt some butter and pour in a large ladle of the paneer pancake batter onto the pan. The batter will spread on its own and settle down.

4.
When you notice bubbles appear on top, flip over and cook the paneer pancake the other side.

5.
Once done, proceed the same way with the remaining batter and transfer the paneer pancakes to a serving plate.

6.
Serve the Paneer Pancake topped with fruits and honey or maple syrup as a wholesome high protein breakfast.

title: Avocado Mash On Toast Recipe
method:
1.
Lightly toast the slices of bread and keep aside to cool down.

2.
Peel the avocado and scoop out the flesh in a bowl.

3.
Add spring onions, lime juice, coriander, green chilli, olive oil and black salt. Mix well.

4.
Spread it evenly on the toasted bread and enjoy.

title: Cream Of Spinach Soup Recipe

ingredient.description: medium Potatoes (½ kg), peeled and cut into 1-inch cubes
and a half cup Chicken or vegetable broth

method:
1.
Take a large saucepan and place over medium heat, add butter, add the chopped onions to the pan and sauté for 4 minutes or until translucent.

2.
Now add the potatoes, chicken broth, water, and bouillon cubes. Bring the mixture to a boil, now reduce the heat to low, cover, and simmer for 20 minutes or until the potatoes are tender. Add spinach and cook for 2 to 4 minutes, until spinach is tender.

3.
Purée the soup mixture in a blender and return the mixture to the saucepan.

4.
Over low heat whisk while adding salt, pepper and sour cream until fully incorporated.

5.
Garnish with chopped chives, sprinkles of allspice, or a dollop of sour cream and serve.

title: Eggs Benedict With Sesame Bagels Recipe

ingredient.description: White Wine Vinegar divided- 2 cups + 3 tbsp
cup Unsalted butter, melted and skimmed-

method:
1.
Combine peppercorns and 2 cups vinegar in a small saucepan over medium-high heat. Cook until reduced by half, about 30 minutes.

2.
Remove from heat; discard peppercorns. Set aside 2 teaspoons vinegar reduction in a small bowl. Save the remainder in an airtight container for another use

3.
Bring 950 ml water to a simmer in a large saucepan over medium-low heat. Place a heatproof bowl on the pan. Add egg yolks and vinegar reduction; whisk constantly until it forms ribbons when the whisk is lifted.

4.
Remove bowl from heat, and slowly whisk in ½ cup melted butter. Return bowl to saucepan and cook for 2 minutes, whisking constantly.

5.
Repeat process with remaining butter until hollandaise mixture reaches a consistency slightly looser than mayonnaise. Whisk in lemon juice, salt, pepper. Set aside.

6.
Boil 3 inches of water in a large saucepan over high heat; reduce heat to medium and maintain at a light simmer. Add remaining vinegar, and stir briskly to form a vortex.

7.
Break 1 egg, and slip into the vortex. Simmer for 2 to 3 minutes, and remove with a slotted spoon. Repeat with the remaining eggs.

8.
Spread a small amount of hollandaise on each bagel half; top each with 1 ham slice and 1 poached egg. Top with more sauce and chopped chives.

title: Steamed Fish In Banana Leaves Recipe
method:
1.
We first need to marinate the fish. For this, take a bowl, add fish chunks, lemon juice and salt. Keep it aside for 10 mins atleast.

2.
Now, take a grinder, add coconut, coriander leaves, green chillies, garlic and cumin seeds to a fine paste.

3.
Once done, wash banana leaves and pat try them. Spread it on the kitchen’s slab and put the marinated fish on top of it. Now spread the paste over it.

4.
Fold the banana leaves neatly and steam them in a steamer with plenty of hot water.

5.
Serve and enjoy!

title: Saunf Ka Sherbat Recipe
method:
1.
Heat a deep non-stick pan, add 3 cups water, fennel seeds, green cardamoms, cloves, black peppercorn, and mix. Cook for 15-20 minutes on a medium heat.

2.
Strain the mixture in a non-stick pan, add Sugar Free Green Powder and cook till tr melts. Take the pan off the heat and allow the syrup to cool completely.

3.
To make one portion, Take a glass and add ½ tablespoon fennel syrup, fresh mint leaves, black salt, salt, ½ tsp roasted fennel powder, ice cubes and pour 1 cup water. Mix and serve immediately.

title: Mango Yogurt Parfait Recipe

ingredient.description: and a half cup Hung Low fat yogurt
A few saffron strands, soaked in water

method:
1.
Take hung yogurt in a bowl, add low calorie sweetner, green cardamom powder, saffron water and whisk till smooth. Transfer into a piping bag and snip the end.

2.
To layer the parfait, add a portion of the muesli into individual serving glasses. Pipe out a portion of the sweetened yogurt, add a portion of the mango pieces, and add 1 tbsp soaked basil seeds into each glass.

3.
Top it with a portion of muesli again, pipe some of the yogurt mixture, add some of the mango pieces and top it up with 1 tsp soaked basil seeds on to each glass. Garnish with mint sprig and serve immediately.

title: Potato And Egg Salad Recipe
method:
1.
Dice some potatoes and boil the same, now remove the skin completely.

2.
Chop the boiled eggs, gherkins, parsley, and chive baton.

3.
Mix all the ingredients together in a bowl along with mayo and then evenly coat the mixture to the sliced potatoes.

4.
Serve and enjoy!

title: Coconut Milk Based Mushrooms With Herb Rice Recipe
method:
1.
Drizzle some oil and then add 2 tsps chopped garlic, 1 tsp of red chilli flakes along with a bowl of steamed rice.

2.
Now add 2 tsps of black pepper powder and 1-1.5 tsp of Garlic Marinade.

3.
Squeeze 1-1.5 tsps of lime juice and cook the rice.

1.
Drizzle some oil in pan. Add 2 tsps freshly chopped garlic & half cup chopped onions.

2.
Add a bowl of chopped mushrooms. Now, add red chilli flakes and mix everything well.

3.
Add a tin of coconut milk for giving it a creamy texture. Add 1.5 tsp of Smokey Garlic Marinade.

4.
Transfer to a bowl and garnish with parsley.

title: Tok Dal (Bengali-Style Raw Mango Dal) Recipe

ingredient.description: Raw mango, deskinned, deseeded and sliced
Salt and sugar, as per taste

method:
1.
Boil the masoor dal with some salt, turmeric powder and green chilli. Keep aside.

2.
Heat mustard oil in kadhai and add red chilli and mustard seeds. Let it splutter.

3.
Add the mango slices, sugar, some salt and mix. Add a little water and close the lid to let it soften.

4.
Add the dal and boil for some time. Adjust salt and sugar as per your taste.

title: Oats Dahi Ke Kabab Recipe
method:
1.
Take hung curd in a bowl, add salt, chilli powder, black pepper, garam masala, green chillies, cilantro and mix well. Now, add oats powder and mix again.

2.
For Stuffing: Take a separate bowl, add raisins, cashew nuts, grated paneer, chaat masala, pinch of sugar and garam masala along with salt.

3.
To make the dough, mix all the ingredients mentioned in the first step. Now, pull out tiny round pieces from the dough and fill it with the stuffing mixture (second step). Roll the kebabs properly.

4.
Fry the round pieces in a Tawa until golden brown. PS: You can also shallow fry the kebabs instead of deep frying.

5.
Sprinkle some chaat masala over the top and serve the hot oats dahi kebabs with mint chutney and enjoy!

title: French Omelette Recipe

ingredient.description: Pinch kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper

method:
1.
Combine the eggs, milk, salt, and pepper in a medium bowl and mix very well with a fork or a whisk. Set a plate by the stove. Heat a small (about 6 inches) seasoned omelette pan or non-stick skillet over medium-high heat.

2.
When the pan is warm, add the butter (it should sizzle gently). Swirl the pan to distribute the butter as it melts. When the butter stops sizzling and the foam subsides add the eggs.

3.
Pause to let the eggs heat slightly and then stir vigorously, with a heatproof spatula, making sure you include the sides of the egg mixture occasionally so the omelette cooks evenly.

4.
Once the eggs are just set, bang the pan gently on the burner to release the omelet from the pan.

5.
Check to see that it is not sticking to the sides or bottom of the pan, if so release the omelet with a heat proof spatula. Hold the pan at a 45-degree angle to the stove and carefully fold the omelette like a business letter.

6.
Cook just until the desired degree of doneness lifting the pan or reducing the heat to prevent browning. (A classic omelet doesn't have any browning on it.) Transfer to a warm plate and serve.

title: Chana Dal Kebab Recipe
method:
1.
Firstly, prepare the batter. Rinse the chana dal and soak it in a bowl for an hour.

2.
After an hour, drain the water and put the dal in the pressure cooker with garlic, ginger, green chilies and 1 cup of water and pressure cook them for 3 whistles.

3.
Once done, turn off the flame. Then, add the pressure cooked ingredients, spinach, and the green peas to the blender with a little water. Blend them into a smooth paste.

4.
Now is the time to transfer this blended paste to a large mixing bowl and add the paneer, salt, garam masala, chaat masala and 1/2 cup of bread crumbs to it. Mix well.

5.
Now take a small amount to make tikki-like structure. Roll it on your palms.

6.
Prepare a flour- water paste in a bowl using the all purpose flour and water. Spread the remaining bread crumbs in a plate.

7.
Heat the refined oil in a kadhai over a medium flame. Now, first dip the kebabs in the flour- water mixture and then roll them in the breadcrumbs.

8.
Next, deep fry the kebabs until they turn golden brown from both the sides. Take them out of the kadhai and drain the excess oil using the clean paper towels.

9.
Serve and enjoy!!

title: No Bake Apple Pie Recipe

ingredient.description: gms Digestive/ Whole Wheat Crackers/Low carb Cheese crackers

method:
1.
Combine coconut oil and graham crackers with some water in a blender and blend until the mixture is lumpy and sticking together. Lay in a cake tin and allow to sit in the fridge.

2.
Heat a non-stick pan and grease with a bit of coconut oil/ vegetable oil.

3.
Peel and slice the apple and put it into a thick bottom pan with water stevia, star anise, lemon juice and cinnamon.

4.
Cook them until the apples are not completely soft.

5.
Lay over the set digestive crust and put it into the fridge for an hour to set.

6.
Place the cooked apples over it and garnish with your favourite nuts.

title: Grated Egg Avocado Toast Recipe
method:
1.
Boil the eggs and transfer to a bowl of cold water. When cooled, peel them.

2.
Toast bread slices, spread mayonnaise over them.

3.
Peel and mash avocado, add salt, pepper and lime juice and mix well.

4.
Spread avocado paste on the toast. Place tomato slices over it.

5.
Grate eggs over the toasts, sprinkle oregano and chilli flakes. Serve.

title: Sticky Date Pudding Recipe

ingredient.description: gram Medjoul dates, pitted and chopped

method:
1.
Preheat the oven to 180°C. Grease and line the base of a 7 cm deep, 22 cm (base) cake pan.

2.
Place dates and baking soda into a bowl. Pour over boiling water. Allow to stand for 20 minutes.

3.
Using an electric mixer, beat butter, sugar, and vanilla until pale and creamy. Add eggs, 1 at a time, beating well after each addition. Using a large metal spoon, fold through date mixture and flour until well combined.

4.
Spoon mixture into prepared cake pan. Bake for 35-40 minutes or until a skewer inserted into the centre comes out clean. Turn onto a plate.

5.
Make sauce. Combine all ingredients in a saucepan over medium heat. Cook, stirring often, until sauce comes to the boil. Reduce heat to medium-low. Simmer for 2 minutes.

6.
Pierce pudding all over with a skewer. Pour 1/2 cup of warm sauce over warm pudding. Stand for 10 minutes. Cut into wedges. Serve with remaining sauce.

title: Date Ice Cream Recipe
method:
1.
Place the chunks of dates, cream, milk and vanilla essence in a saucepan and simmer it over low heat and stir it continuously for 10 minutes, Remove pan from heat and purée the mixture with a stick blender or any sort of blender.

2.
In a separate bowl, whisk the egg yolks with the salt. Then let it rest for 10 minutes, slowly stir the yolks into the pan and return it to the stove. Cook over low heat for 5 minutes, until the mixture is thick enough to coat the back of a spoon.

3.
Pour the mixture into a container, cover it with plastic wrap and leave to cool. Then pour the mixture into an ice cream container and freeze the mixture for 2 hours.

4.
Serve and enjoy

title: Avocado Toast Recipe

ingredient.description: Slices Sourdough bread or multigrain bread
good drizzle extra virgin olive oil

method:
1.
Cut the avocado in half and carefully remove its stone, then scoop out the flesh into a bowl. Squeeze in the lemon juice then mash with a fork to your desired texture.

2.
Season to taste with sea salt, black pepper and. chilli flakes

3.
Toast your bread, drizzle over the oil then pile the avocado on top.

4.
Avocado toast is ready!

title: Mint Gur Sharbat Recipe

ingredient.description: A pinch of pink salt and jeera powder

method:
1.
In a glass add some jeera powder.

2.
Now take some mint leaves and grind them to take out its juice.

3.
Add the mint juice with a few leaves in a glass.

4.
Then add one tablespoon of gur (jaggery) water in the glass with a hint of pink salt.

5.
Add crushed ice, and chilled water. Mix and enjoy!

title: Jackfruit And Spinach Sambar Recipe

ingredient.description: and a half tbsp Sambar Powder

method:
1.
In a pressure cooker, add toor dal, jackfruit seeds and water. Pressure cook for 2 whistles.

2.
Meanwhile, in a pan roast Grated Coconut with sambar powder. Grind this mix using little water to form a paste.

3.
Sauté Lady’s finger and Tomato in another pan and keep aside.

4.
Into the cooker add in drumstick, spinach stalks & Shallots and cook on medium flame.

5.
Once it starts boiling, add the coconut paste and cook till the raw profile disappears.

6.
Now add in sautéed Lady’s Finger and Tomato. Cook for few minutes.

7.
Then add tamarind water and bring the sambar to boil.

8.
Meanwhile, in another pan temper mustard seeds, curry leaf and shallots in coconut oil.

9.
Pour the tempering over the sambar and remove it from flame. Nutritious Jackfruit Seed and Spinach sambar is ready.

title: Cucumber & Coriander Smoothie Recipe
method:
1.
Take one cucumber and roughly chop it.

2.
Add this to a blender with a cup of coriander leaves and some water. Blend it to make juice.

3.
Now in a glass, add some pink salt and pepper with some ice cubes. Now pour in the prepared juice.

4.
Drink it cold and fresh to enjoy!

title: Komal - Gujarati Chaas Recipe
method:
1.
Take dahi, coconut milk, coriander leaves, green chillies in a bowl, with some water and blend with hand blender. Keep aside.

2.
Heat oil in a pan and add jeera, hing, and curry leaves. Let it splutter.

3.
Add the tadka to the drink and serve. You can take out the chillies before serving.

title: Iranian Omelette Recipe
method:
1.
Heat a pan and add crushed garlic to it.

2.
Then add chopped tomatoes and let them cook.

3.
Till then, side by side slice the onions and fry them to a crisp.

4.
Once that is done check the tomatoes and add salt, pepper, cinnamon, and red chilli powder. Mix again.

5.
Now, crack two eggs on the tomato base and let them cook.

6.
Once the eggs are ready, garnish them with fried onions. Serve with a flat bread and enjoy the taste!

title: Almond And Cauliflower Rice Salad Recipe
method:
1.
Roast the almonds with skin in preheated oven at 180 degree celsius for 4 minutes and cut into slivers, once it is cooled.

2.
In a pan, heat olive oil and crackle cumin seed, add chopped ginger, chopped green chilli and saute for 10-15 seconds.

3.
Stir-in pulsed cauliflower and cook for a minute or till tender.

4.
Take off the pan from flame and finish up with lemon juice, freshly chopped coriander and adjust seasoning with salt and pepper.

5.
Add roasted slivered almonds to it.

6.
Serve fluffy textured pulao.

title: Watermelon And Sweet Potato Salad With Broiled Quinoa And Shikanji Dressing Recipe
method:
1.
Prepare two big slices of watermelon and add 2 tbsp of dressing on it so that it gets soaked in. Keep it for 20 minutes in a fridge

2.
Cut the sweet potato (skin less) into dices and boil them till done up to 90 percent. Pat dry them and remove access moisture. Heat ghee in a pan and fry them, till golden brown.

3.
Quick boil the quinoa and strain it. Let it cool and then broil it in a hot pan to attain crispy texture.

4.
Place the watermelon on a plate and top it with the sweet potatoes and quinoa.

5.
Drizzle the remain dressing and finish with micro greens and serve.

1.
Mix all the ingredients to make a fine dressing.

title: Healthy Paneer Pizza Recipe

ingredient.description: Oregano and red chilli flakes to taste

method:
1.
Make pizza sauce by cooking tomato puree with all the spices and basil in olive oil.

2.
Spread the sauce on pizza base.

3.
Top it with onions, tomatoes, capsicum, mushrooms and olives.

4.
Grate and splay paneer on top of it.

title: Buckwheat Crepe with Strawberry Stew Recipe

ingredient.description: gms Buckwheat Flour or Mixed seeds flour/Black wheat flour
ml Low fat Milk/ Coconut milk

method:
1.
For the crepe, combine buckwheat flour, low fat milk, crushed flax seeds and water and make a thin batter. Add a pinch of salt

2.
Heat a non-stick pan and grease with a bit of coconut oil/ vegetable oil.

3.
Add a thin layer of the batter and spread it on the non-stick pan.

4.
For the stew, cut the strawberries into thick slices.

5.
Take a heavy bottom pan and add the strawberries with a little bit of water and cinnamon stick and star anise.

6.
Cook for fifteen minutes until the strawberries are cooked through but still holding their shape and the sauce is thickened.

7.
Adjust the sweetness to your liking.

8.
Spoon the stew over the cooked crepes and enjoy.

title: Gajar Matar Khichdi Recipe
method:
1.
Soak dal and water together for about one hour.

2.
In a pressure cooker, saute hing and cumin seeds in ghee. Once they crackle, add green chillies.

3.
Add grated carrots and peas, salt, garam masala and turmeric powder. Saute for 2-3 minutes.

4.
Add rice and dal, add water as per required consistency.

5.
Cook and serve hot with a dollop of ghee and dahi or achaar.

title: Chilli Garlic Omelette Recipe
method:
1.
Break two eggs in a glass, whisk it properly.

2.
Once done add chopped garlic, salt, chilli flakes and red chilli powder.

3.
Mix everything again.

4.
Heat a dollop of butter in a pan, pour the whisked egg batter, flip and cook the omelette from both sides.

5.
You can also add a slice of cheese to give it a balanced taste.

6.
Serve and enjoy!

title: Aloe Vera Ki Subzi Recipe
method:
1.
Firstly, wash the leaves and remove the thorns. Once done, slit lengthwise and make thin strips almost like ribbon size. It will help absorb more flavours.

2.
Now pressure cook the leaves with little water until one whistle.

3.
Mix dry ingredients like dhania powder, turmeric powder, amchur, salt, a little jaggery and a little water. Now, pour it into hot mustard oil and roast till it looks glazed. Keep stirring.

4.
In another pan, add hing, oil, cumin seeds, broken dry red chillies and let them crackle. Add the boiled Aloe Vera strips and toss them well. Now add this mix to the roasted masala.

5.
Add some raisins, chopped green chillies, coriander leaves, toss and mix it well.

6.
Finally, sprinkle a little bit of mustard seeds (rai) powder and mix again. Let this subzi rest for 2-3 hours before serving.

7.
It tastes great the next day!

title: Protein Balls Recipe
method:
1.
Place the almonds in a food processor and pulse until they are finely chopped.

2.
Add the apricot, dates, honey and orange zest and pulse until a dough consistency is achieved. Roll one heaping teaspoon of dough into little ball then roll the ball through desiccated coconut. Set aside. Repeat until all the dough is used up.

3.
The energy balls can be stored in an airtight container in the fridge for up to 1 week.

title: Aloo Corn Cutlets Recipe
method:
1.
In a small blender take boiled corn or frozen corn blend to coarse paste without adding any water. Keep 2tbsp corn kernels aside.

2.
Transfer the paste to a large mixing bowl and add boiled and mashed potato (Leached), additionally add onion, capsicum, chilli and ginger paste, spices and salt.

3.
Add ¼ cup bread crumbs, 1 tbsp roasted besan,1 tbsp corn flour, 2 tbsp of boiled corn removed separately and kept and crushed black pepper, also add lemon juice and combine everything well to form a dough.

4.
Add in more bread crumbs if there is too much moisture.

5.
Make bullet shaped kebabs greasing hands with oil.

6.
Deep fry them into hot oil and fry till the kebabs turn golden brown on medium flame and serve hot.

title: Rava Chana Idli Recipe
method:
1.
In a kadai, heat oil and temper with mustard seeds, chana dal, curry leaves, cashewnut and ginger. Add suji and roast for a few minutes.

2.
Add salt and mix well.

3.
Once the rava cools down, add curd and mix well and set it aside for 30 minutes.

4.
After 30 minutes, the mixture will soak up all the curd, add water to get idli batter consistency. Add baking soda and mix well.

5.
Take an idli stand and place little grated carrot on the greased mould. Pour the batter and steam for 10-15 minutes.

6.
Once done, remove the rava idlis and serve hot with ghee and roasted Bengal gram chutney.

title: Beetroot Pulao Recipe
method:
1.
Soak rice in water for at least half an hour.

2.
Fry cumin seeds in hot oil; saute onions, green chilli and ginger-garlic paste.

3.
Saute tomatoes, salt and all the spices.

4.
Add chopped beetroot and potatoes and rice.

5.
Add water and let it all cook. Serve hot.

title: Anda Methi Bhurji Recipe
method:
1.
Heat ghee/oil in a pan. Saute cumin seeds till they change colour.

2.
Saute onion, green chillies and garlic.

3.
Saute tomatoes and garlic with salt, red chilli powder, coriander seeds and turmeric powder.

4.
Add methi leaves and cook till they wilt. Break the eggs onto the mixture and whisk till they cook.

5.
Add garam masala powder, Mix and serve with the garnishing of coriander leaves.

title: Beetroot-Amla Juice Recipe
method:
1.
Add beetroot, amla, ginger, pudina in a blender and blend.

2.
Add water and blend.

3.
To it, add jeera powder, salt and honey and blend once.

4.
Strain and serve in a tall glass.

title: Chicken Shawarma Salad Recipe

ingredient.description: Salt and black pepper to taste

method:
1.
Marinate chicken with all the ingredients for at least half an hour.

2.
Grill the chicken, cut into thin slices, and keep aside.

3.
In a bowl, put in lettuce leaves, onion , tomato and cucumber. Add mayonnaise, salt and pepper. Mix well.

4.
In the salad bowl or plate, place the veggie mixture and top with frilled chicken slices. Serve with pita bread.

title: Anda Khichdi Recipe
method:
1.
Saute onions with ginger-garlic paste and green chillies.

2.
Add tomatoes, salt and red chilli powder, and cook.

3.
Bread 3 eggs into it and scramble till cooked. Whisk well.

4.
Add in the leftover khichdi, garam masala powder, and mix well.

title: Dhaba-Style Methi Malai Matar Recipe
method:
1.
First make the dry masala. Add green cardamom, cloves, cumin seeds, whole black peppercorns, cinnamon stick, mace and black cardamom in a blender and make ground spice powder and keep it aside.

2.
Next, add some water in a heavy bottomed pan and let it boil. Once it starts boiling add onion, cashew nuts, green chillies, garlic and ginger to the boiling water.

3.
Once it is boiled, drain the water and make a ground paste of boiled onion, cashew nuts, green chillies, ginger and garlic cloves and keep it aside.

4.
Next, blanch the fenugreek leaves to enhance the colour of the dish. Add methi leaves in hot water in a pan. After a minute, add it to the chilled water for about 2 minutes.

5.
Now drain the water and squeeze out whatever remaining water in methi and keep it aside.

6.
Heat ghee in a wok or a heavy bottomed pan, add wet ground paste and cook it for 5 minutes till spice starts releasing oil.

7.
Now add green peas and milk, let it cook for another minute.

8.
Add dry spice powder which we made earlier and coriander powder. Mix it well and cook for another 3 to 4 minutes on medium flame.

9.
Now add blanched methi, salt, sugar, mix it well and cook for 2 more minutes.

10.
If you find consistency too thick, you can adjust it by adding milk.

11.
Add cardamom powder, kasuri methi and cream, mix well and cook for 2 to 3 minutes more.

12.
The methi malai mattar is ready! Serve hot.

title: Corn Poha Recipe
method:
1.
Boil the corns and keep aside.

2.
Wash poha and drain the water.

3.
Heat oil in pan, add mustard seeds. When they start to splutter, add curry leaves. Saute for a minute.

4.
Saute onions, green chilli and ginger-garlic paste.

5.
Add tomatoes, salt, red chilli powder and turmeric powder. Saute till cooked.

6.
Add boiled corns and mix well. Add poha, drizzle some water. Mix well and serve with the garnishing of coriander leaves.

title: Pongal Recipe
method:
1.
Wash rice 2-3 times with fresh water and soak it in the water for ½ hr. Wash dal and roast it in a pan for 3-5 min with 1 tsp of ghee .

2.
Add roasted dal-soaked rice (drain the water) and water, and cook it on a low heat till it becomes soft in texture and mushy. Add water if needed.

3.
To get creamy consistency, add some hot water to bring it to a consistency you like. Add salt if needed and stir well.

4.
In a pan make the tempered mix using ghee, cumin seeds and crushed black pepper, ginger, curry leaves, green chili, and asafoetida. Sauté for some time.

5.
Then add turmeric, cooked moong dal and rice. Sauté for some time until the moong dal becomes aromatic .

6.
Pour another 250 ml of water and salt. Slowly mix well and cook it again on slow fire. Just ensure that the bottom of the pan is clear.

7.
Once done, serve with sambhar or chutney.

8.
As some people like little runny, you can adjust the consistency by adding more or less water.

title: Whole Wheat Chicken Momo Recipe
method:
1.
In a bowl add the meat, onions, ginger, coriander leaves, and butter and mix well.

2.
Use your hands to properly rub all the ingredients together, add salt according to taste and let it rest for 10-15 minutes.

3.
In the meanwhile, make a dough by mixing atta, a pinch of salt, oil, and water. Mix lightly hard dough and keep aside.

4.
Make tiny balls out of the dough and roll out the tiny balls of dough in the size of a small poori.

5.
Place a spoonful of filling in the middle and use a mold to shape the dumpling.

6.
Or you can gather all the sides together and pinch it.

7.
Grease the steaming plates with oil and let this steam for 20-30 minutes.

8.
Check if the outer dough is cooked and serve hot.

title: Chicken Hara Bhara Kebab Recipe
method:
1.
Boil spinach leaves and peas. Crush the peas. Peel the potatoes and crush.

2.
Saute onion and ginger-garlic paste.

3.
Add minced chicken, salt and all the spice powders.

4.
When cooked, add in blanched spinach, peas and potatoes.

5.
Make small roundels out of the mixture and flatten them slightly.

6.
Coat in rice flour and fry.

title: Sarson Makki Saag Recipe
method:
1.
First, wash and finely chop 1 bunch mustard leaves (sarson ke patte) and ½ bunch spinach (palak). Add bathua leaves.

2.
Take the chopped leaves in a pressure cooker along with chopped garlic, ginger, ¼ onion, 2 chilli and ½ tsp salt.

3.
Add 1 cup water and pressure cook for 4 whistles.

4.
Mash until coarsely ground.

5.
Further add 2 tbsp of makki ka atta and mix well. Cook for 5 minutes or until the mixture thickens. keep aside.

6.
Now in a large kadai, heat 2 tbsp ghee, and saute 2 clove garlic, 1 inch ginger and 1 green chilli.

7.
Next saute 1 onion until it turns golden brown. Add in cooked and mashed leaves and mix well.

8.
Continue to cook for 4-5 minutes, or until the saag is cooked completely.

9.
Finally, enjoy sarso ka saag with makki ki roti or with chapati.

title: Birbal Ki Khichdi Recipe
method:
1.
Mix urad dal white, moong and channa dal throughly, wash and rinse well. Keep it to boil along with boiled rice and broken wheat. Keep stirring behind boils to make sure that it is not getting burnt from the base.

2.
We will soon see that the consistency of Khichdi starts to get thickened.

3.
As soon as the dal along with broken wheat and rice gets emulsified then shut the gas and store it at a cool place.

4.
In another pan, add ghee and cumin seeds. Once it starts to crackle add chopped garlic and ginger, julienne of haricot beans and carrots.

5.
Sauté the mixture nicely then add khichdi along with fresh mint leaves, brown onion, turmeric and deggi mirch powder.

6.
Mix everything together and allow it to cook until you get a greasy texture.

7.
Finally add salt and ajwain as per your palate and do not forget to finish it with lots of ghee. Now enjoy it.

title: Creamy Spinach Soup Recipe
method:
1.
Heat the water and boil the spinach leaves till soft.

2.
In a blender, blend the spinach and water.

3.
Sieve the puree.

1.
In a non-stick vessel, heat the olive oil, add the oregano, spring onions and saute for ½ minute.

2.
Add the spinach puree, milk, salt and pepper to taste. Cook for 2 minutes.

1.
Serve hot.

2.
Garnish with cheese and croutons.

title: Whole Wheat Bread Spinach Sandwich Recipe
method:
1.
Heat the extra virgin olive oil in a pan and add the diced onions, sauteing till golden brown.

2.
Add baby spinach and cook till it wilts.

3.
Add the fresh dill, parsley, garlic and pepper and combine.

4.
Empty into a bowl and add the ricotta, feta and combine into a mixture. Add cheddar slices to Wholewheat. Bread and top with spinach and cheese mixture.

5.
In a pan, add extra virgin olive oil and unsalted butter and toast the sandwiches till the cheese melts. Serve hot.

title: Doodh Poha Recipe
method:
1.
Soak the poha in water for a minute or two and drain out the excess water. Keep aside.

2.
Boil the milk with cardamom and bay leaf.

3.
Add the soaked poha in it and stir to avoid burning.

4.
When you get the desired consistency, lower the flame and add jaggery or sugar and mix everything together.

5.
Add the dried fruits and nuts and mix.

title: Dahi Paneer Recipe
method:
1.
Toss the paneer pieces with turmeric powder, Kashmiri red chili powder, and salt.

2.
Heat oil in a flat skillet over medium-high heat.

3.
Arrange the paneer pieces on the skillet and fry from two sides until lightly browned. Remove on a plate.

4.
Whisk yogurt with coriander powder, turmeric powder, Kashmiri red chili powder, garam masala powder, and cashew nut paste. Set aside.

5.
You can add a tablespoon of chickpea flour (besan) or all-purpose flour (maida) to the yogurt to make a thicker and creamier curry.

6.
Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Add the remaining oil from frying the paneer to the same pan.

7.
Once the oil is hot, add dry red chilies, green cardamoms, cloves, and cumin seeds and let them crackle for 4-5 seconds.

8.
Add ginger and green chilies and fry for 20-30 seconds.

9.
Now add the yogurt whisked with the spices to the pan.

10.
Cook for 12-15 minutes and keep stirring continuously to avoid the yogurt from curdling.

11.
Add the fried paneer cubes to the pan and cook for 4-5 minutes. You can add some water if the curry is thick for your liking.

12.
Add salt and Kasuri methi and cook for another minute. Serve hot.

title: Dahi Poha Recipe
method:
1.
Firstly, wash the poha in running water.

2.
Then transfer the poha in a bowl of dahi.

3.
Mix everything together.

4.
Transfer it to serving bowls and drizzle gud as much as you want.

5.
Garnish with dry fruits and serve.

title: Green Onion and Mushroom Omelette Recipe
method:
1.
Finely chop mushrooms in processor. Melt butter in medium skillet over medium-high heat.

2.
Add mushrooms and onions; sauté for 3 minutes. Add vermouth and boil until evaporated, about 1 and a 1/2 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.

3.
Whisk eggs, 1 tablespoon water, salt, and pepper in medium bowl to blend. Melt 1 teaspoon butter in small nonstick skillet over medium heat.

4.
Add half of egg mixture. Stir with back of the fork until edges begin to set.

5.
Cook until omelet is set, lifting edges with spatula to let uncooked egg flow underneath, about 2 minutes.

6.
Spoon half of mushroom mixture down center of omelet. Fold both sides of omelet over filling and transfer to plate.

7.
Repeat with remaining butter, egg mixture, and mushroom mixture. Sprinkle omelets with remaining onions.
